Header.title: AirBridge
Header.paragraph: bridges between the operator, authority and/or other stakeholders to enable efficient and scalable use of airspace for drone operations while managing the associated risk
Header.contenttitle1: Authenticated access to the airspace, including for current drone operations to future Advanced Air Mobility concepts. Safety and security of the equipment, goods and articles of our customer
Header.contenttitle2: Route optimization and automated authorisation services to optimise the use of airspace Platform ostic and interoperable for scalability
Header.contenttitle3: Supports complex UA Operations, providing situational awareness and deconfliction to reduce associated safety risk

Why: Flight Safety and Security – UA operations needs to provide assurance on safety and security, especially operations that are more complex like UAM and AAM.
Commercial Viability – When not well coordinated, UA operations becomes highly disorganized when scale, which limits its scalability.
Operational Complexity – UA operations are dependent on external factors, like weather, and other third-party assets not within the control of the operator
Why2: Increasing number of commercial operators - ~20% y-o-y.
A growing community of recreational UA flyers and drone hobbyists

Why: Flight Safety and Security – UA operations needs to provide assurance on safety and security, especially operations that are more complex like UAM and AAM.
Commercial Viability – When not well coordinated, UA operations becomes highly disorganized when scale, which limits its scalability.
Operational Complexity – UA operations are dependent on external factors, like weather, and other third-party assets not within the control of the operator
Why2: Provides collision free routes and schedules
Uses trajectory based operations and equivalent CNS model to perform strategic deconfliction and contingencies management to optimize the use of a designated airspace

Why: Flight Safety and Security – UA operations needs to provide assurance on safety and security, especially operations that are more complex like UAM and AAM.
Commercial Viability – When not well coordinated, UA operations becomes highly disorganized when scale, which limits its scalability.
Operational Complexity – UA operations are dependent on external factors, like weather, and other third-party assets not within the control of the operator
Why2: Designed and built to provide the single source-of-truth airspace data for UTM services.
Amalgamation of supplementary datasets necessary for safe UAS operations
Create, publish and store 4D constraints in the airspace in realtime

Services.name: Demonstrated Solution
Services.text: The Heron AirBridge system was fully integrated into baseline UTM system, and demonstrated in Singapore's complex maritime environment supporting multiple concurrent BVLOS flight

Services.name: Platform Agnostic
Services.text: Platform agnostic, and interoperable to allow integration with any UAS operators' FMS/GCS and other UTM service providers

Services.name: Moudalar and Scalable
Services.text: Modularity and scalability designed to cater to the specific needs of the customer

Features.text: Display the real-time location of vessels/manned aircraft/weather information over the flight Area of Operations
Notification and Advisories for airspace control and management
Post incident report generation for investigation or follow up
Post flight telemetry recording to enable Data Analytics

Features2.text: Authenticate and manage assets, i.e. pilots and aircraft
Conformance monitoring and tracking real-time position of UAS, provide airspace situation picture and weather
Manage airspace constraints and NFZ (Authority only)
